results.title: Robert Indiana: portrait
results.brief_description: A film about Robert Indiana; the artist and his art, and the meaning in language. One of the best known “pop” artists in America, Robert Indiana gives his opinions and feelings on not just his art, but life in general, and his studio, paintings and everyday life are seen. Highly recommended to classes in both art and language arts. Music by Virgil Thomson.

results.title: Roads in the sky
results.creator_credit: International Civil Aviation Organization. Public Information Office
results.brief_description: Role of aviation in less technologically developed regions of the world. Tells the story of how the aeroplane helps economic development where roads and railways cannot economically be built. Includes a modern Canadian airport; a Mardi Gras, and mountainous terrain with old and new modes of land travel in Haiti; air commerce in the Brazilian hinterland and Brazilia.

results.title: Riverboat heritage
results.creator_credit: Brad Smart, Russell Hurley and Russell Hurley Film Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a comprehensive chronological history of the riverboats that travelled the major rivers, particularly the Murray. Portrays the transportation of supplies to inland farmers and goldseekers and the transportation of farm products to the markets of yesteryear. to the service of the tourist trade of today. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Rip-offs
results.creator_credit: Alex Stiff and Victoria. Ministry of Consumer Affairs
results.brief_description: Animation in the style of “Life Be in it”, outlining money making scams the consumer should be aware of. Uses real life stries to illustrate these pitfalls with cartoon characters ‘Oscar Wilde’ and ‘Samuel Johnson’.

results.title: Riding on air: the HM-2 Sidewall hovercraft
results.creator_credit: Ken Blackman and Southern Photographic Studios

results.title: Riding for the disabled
results.creator_credit: Antonius Kroger and Kuratorium fur Therapeutisches
results.brief_description: A demonstration of how horses and horse riding are used as therapy for mentally handicapped children. Shows how the therapeutic techniques help develop both physical and social skills.

results.title: Rice and Agricultural Development
results.creator_credit: National Farm Cinema Association of Japan
results.brief_description: Japan, as the most advanced agricultural nation of Asia, has the experience and technique to help Afro-Asian economies, by improvements in agriculture. As part of this assistance, the Ibaraki International Agricultural Training Centre teaches better rice cultivation to foreign students.z
